alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:51AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Little River, southern McCurtain, Franklin, northern Wood, northwestern Bowie, northwestern Upshur, northwestern Morris, Titus, Camp and Red River Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 551 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Manchester to 9 miles west of Mount Vernon. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Pittsburg, Winnsboro, Clarksville, Hagansport, Leesburg, Boxelder, Mount Vernon, Quitman, De Kalb, Bogata, Omaha, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Arkinda, Scroggins, Pleasant Grove, Newsome, Purley, Dalby Springs and Cookville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
